file_content.text: I knew you would come to me, servants of the Sith.
It is brave of you to face me yourself, Sith.
I knew you would come to me, hunter. Your Sith masters fear to face me themselves.
So, you come on behalf of the Sith? You have courage.
I ordained Jokull to conquer Voss, and you have beaten him. You have displeased my master.
I didn't come this far to talk to an underling. Bring your master.
I want to see your master.
You are foolish, little creature.
You "ordained" him? You're the source of his visions?
You gave Jokull his power?
Jokull was meant to lead the Gormak against the Voss, so that their war could feed my master.
So what if I have?
I serve Sel-Makor, the darkness that devours this world. He will consume Voss and all who live here.
And I will offer you as a sacrifice to his endless appetite!
I have been a prisoner in the darkness so long... I must repay you for this.
I am in your debt. Sel-Makor still lives, but at last I am free of him.
You have questions. My time grows short, but I will give you what answers I can.
You don't sound like any Gormak I've met, or Voss for that matter.
You speak Basic?
I learned your tongue from the Jedi, long ago.
Who are you? Why should I listen to you?
Explain yourself.
Tell me what's going on here--now.
Then talk.
In that case, start talking.
Information is always welcome.
I am a terrible fool.
My name is Nemok-Ta, and I once aided the Jedi in their war against the Sith.
The creature you faced was an avatar of Sel-Makor. And I am one of those who brought his evil upon us all.
What is he? Where does he get his power? Start talking, and I'll tell you when to stop.
Tell me about Sel-Makor.
His story begins with the Sith.
How did you bring this about?
You're responsible?
With greed and arrogance.
Long ago, the Sith came to our world. To them, we were beasts, unworthy of notice. But then the Jedi arrived, pursuing them.
To the Jedi, we were tools--weapons to turn against the Sith.
The Jedi manipulated you into doing their dirty work.
You were used.
The records in the Ruined City say it was the Voss who fought the Sith, not the Gormak.
You're confused.
There was only one people here, until the Jedi came. We asked for power, they agreed if we would fight their enemies.
We were greedy, insisted on learning all the secrets of the Force, heedless of the consequences.
The Force rituals changed us. Those who studied with them became Voss. Those who did not became Gormak.
All the conflict here has been the fault of Jedi interference?
The Jedi started all this?
No, the fault is ours. We fought for the Jedi because we wanted power.
Even my own people have forgotten. You couldn't have known.
Is Sel-Makor a Voss? A Jedi? Sith? Something else entirely?
What about Sel-Makor?
Sel-Makor was born from the sundering of my people. He is the darkness that devours this world.
He feeds on strife, and so long as my people fight each other, the Nightmare Lands will grow.
Please, outsider, return to Voss-Ka and tell my people that they threaten Voss with their fighting. Sel-Makor must be stopped.
Start with introductions.
I want to know everything.
And then what?
The Voss are really Gormak?
